main_definition: To come or go after something, or to do as someone else does.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Past the point in time when something occurred; subsequent to an event.
meanings_and_examples.example: The meeting was followed by a lunch break.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To adhere to or obey instructions, orders, or guidance from someone else.
meanings_and_examples.example: I always followed my father's advice on how to live life.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To come after something in a sequence; succeeding an event or object.
meanings_and_examples.example: The second movie was followed by the third one, and both were equally successful.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To accept the style, manner, or influence of someone else as a model to be imitated.
meanings_and_examples.example: After watching his favorite actor's performance, he began to follow their acting techniques in school plays.
